definition: untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting

sentences.english: Singapore, when I just came here, you were the transpiration with all purities.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡，我初來的時候，你是一塵不染的通透。

sentences.english: Yeah. I promise that I'll keep it spick and span.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我保證每天都要把這兒收拾得一塵不染。

sentences.english: Jane, how do you do this? Your plates are always spotless.
sentences.chinese: 簡，你是怎麼弄的？你家的碟子總是一塵不染。

sentences.english: She dusted every bit of dirt off her dining table.
sentences.chinese: 她將她的餐桌抹拭得一塵不染。

sentences.english: They lived upstairs in spotless quarters, although the bathroom was in the backyard.
sentences.chinese: 雖然洗手間在院子裏，他們的臥室可是一塵不染。

sentences.english: And, you can find him keeping the post office spotlessly clean six days a week.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到，他每星期六天把郵局整理得一塵不染。

sentences.english: My mom likes my room to be squeaky-clean.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽喜歡我的房間一塵不染。
一輛一塵不染的出租車停在面前。

sentences.english: After washing the car for two hours, the windshields were squeaky-clean.
sentences.chinese: 洗車兩個小時下來，擋風玻璃乾淨到一塵不染。

sentences.english: The tables were immaculately laid with fine silverware and Wedgwood china .
sentences.chinese: 下表是一塵不染奠定細銀器和韋奇伍德瓷器。

sentences.english: Everything was spotlessly clean in her room.
sentences.chinese: 在她屋裏樣樣東西都一塵不染。

sentences.english: Here are some more tips to keep your tech gadgets spick and span.
sentences.chinese: 以下是更多讓你的科技產品一塵不染的訣竅。

sentences.english: For this reason, the common color of hospital scrubs is a light green.
sentences.chinese: 因此，醫院的牆一般都被刷成一塵不染的淡綠色。

sentences.english: The room was spotless and silent.
sentences.chinese: 廁所裏一塵不染，悄然無聲。

sentences.english: The centre of the city is spotlessly [stainlessly] clean.
sentences.chinese: 市中心一塵不染干乾淨淨。

definition: everything clear and orderly (idiom); neat and tidy
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
perfect and without blemish/flawless/to leave nothing to be desired
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
to relax with one's eyes closed
